title: Dene Miller
text:
Dene Miller (born ) is a former <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Scotland</a> international <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 2000s. He played at club level for the <a href="St%20Albans%20Centurions">St Albans Centurions</a> and the <a href="London%20Skolars">London Skolars</a>.
Background.
Dene Miller was born in <a href="Welwyn%20Garden%20City">Welwyn Garden City</a>, <a href="Hertfordshire">Hertfordshire</a>, England, he has <a href="Scottish%20people">Scottish</a> <a href="ancestor">ancestor</a>s, and eligible to play for <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Scotland</a> due to the <a href="Grandfather%20rule">grandparent rule</a>.
Playing career.
International honours.
Dene Miller won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Scotland</a> whilst at St Albans Centurions in 2006 against Wales (sub).
Club career.
Dene Miller signed for London Skolars making his début in the Northern Rail cup against holders <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh Centurions</a>, he became the first player at the London Skolars to win the Northern Rail "player of the round" award after scoring a <a href="hat-trick">hat-trick</a> of tries against <a href="Sheffield%20Eagles">Sheffield Eagles</a> in the group stages.
